title: 107_s1210
content: The text chunk "SECTION 1. SHORT TITLE." is a concise statement indicating the beginning of a section with a short title. The Act titled "Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Reauthorization Act of 2002" reauthorizes the Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Act of 1996. It amends sections related to block grants and federal guarantees, extending the years covered from 1998 through 2007. The Act amends various sections by extending the years covered from 1997 through 2007, including training and technical assistance and the Indian Housing Loan Guarantee Fund. The Act extends the years covered from 1997 through 2007 for various sections, including training, technical assistance, and the Indian Housing Loan Guarantee Fund. The Act extends the years covered from 1997 through 2007 for various sections, including training, technical assistance, and the Indian Housing Loan Guarantee Fund. SEC. 3. DEFINITIONS. Section 4 of the Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Act of 1996 is amended to include a definition of "housing related community development" as any tribally-owned facility or infrastructure that aids in the construction of reservation housing and reduces construction costs. The Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Act of 1996 is amended to define "housing related community development" as tribally-owned facilities or infrastructure aiding in reservation housing construction and cost reduction. Exclusion: Indian Gaming Regulatory Act activities are not considered under housing and community development. SEC. 4. BLOCK GRANTS AND GRANT REQUIREMENTS amended to include comprehensive housing and community development planning activities. SEC. 5. TREATMENT OF PROGRAM INCOME AND LABOR STANDARDS. Section 104 of the Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Act of 1996 is amended to require recipients to utilize income for housing related activities in accordance with the Act. Subsection (a)(2) is amended to include "Restricted Access or" before the word "Reduction" in the heading. Section 104 of the Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Act of 1996 is amended to require recipients to utilize income for housing-related activities. Subsection (a)(2) is amended to include "Restricted Access or Reduction" before the word "Reduction" and to add a new clause regarding the expenditure of retained program income for housing-related activities. SEC. 6. REGULATIONS. Section 106(b)(2)(A) of the Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Act of 1996 is amended to include regulations required under the Act, including any future amendments. Section 601 is also amended to include housing-related community development activities consistent with the Act's purposes. SEC. 8. FEASIBILITY STUDIES TO IMPROVE HOUSING ASSISTANCE IN NATIVE COMMUNITIES: A study will be conducted by the Secretary to assess the feasibility of a community development demonstration project in line with Indian self-determination principles and the Act's objectives. The Secretary shall conduct a study on the feasibility of establishing a demonstration project for Indian tribes to use funds from the Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Reauthorization Act of 2002 for community development projects. The Secretary shall conduct a study on the feasibility of establishing a demonstration project for Indian tribes under the Indian Self-Determination and Education Assistance Act, and submit the study to relevant Senate and House committees. The Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Reauthorization Act of 2002 authorizes Indian tribes to receive assistance for Federal housing projects with a focus on tribal authority and decision-making. The Secretary is required to conduct a study on this project's feasibility and report to relevant Senate committees within a year. The Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Reauthorization Act of 2002 authorizes Indian tribes to receive assistance for Federal housing projects with a focus on tribal authority and decision-making. The Act requires the Secretary to conduct a feasibility study and report to relevant Senate and House committees. SEC. 9. BLACK MOLD INFESTATION STUDY. The Secretary of Housing and Urban Development must complete a study on black mold infestation in Native American housing within 180 days of this Act's enactment. A report with recommendations to address the infestation must be submitted to Congress.
